nodes.label: Data Reasoning
nodes.text: Analysing data to make grounded conclusions

nodes.label: Pattern Recognition and Decomposition
nodes.text: Pattern recognition, decomposition, determining which (if any) computing tools could be employed in the analysing or solving the problem, and defining algorithms as part of a detailed solution
nodes.citation: OECD. (2018). The Future of Education and Skills: Education 2030. Position Paper. http://www.oecd.org/education/2030/E2030%20Position%20Paper%20(05.04.2018).pdf

nodes.label: Computational Thinking
nodes.text: Computational thinking is using abstraction and decomposition when attacking a large complex task or designing a large complex system

nodes.label: Continuity and Change
nodes.text: Judging about continuity and change, thus understanding individual elements and their relationships

nodes.label: Argumentation through Analysis

nodes.label: Identify Constituent Parts
nodes.text: Identify constituent parts and functions of a process or concept, or de-construct a methodology or process, making qualitative assessment of elements, relationships, values and effects; measure requirements or needs

nodes.text: Mathematical reasoning includes making judgements about the validity of information that bombards individuals by means of considering their quantitative and logical implications

nodes.text: Inductive, deductive, and analogical reasoning is activated

nodes.text: Evaluating info (of various types or forms)

nodes.text: Inductive, deductive, and analogical reasoning is activated
